column4: et òmnia qŭaĕ intra me sunt nómini sancto ejus. ^ Bless the Lord
column6: and let all that is within me bless his holy name.

column4: et noli oblivísci omnes retributiónes ejus. ^ Bless the Lord
column6: and never forget all he hath done for thee.

column1: 3 ^ Qŭi propitiátur òmnibus iniqŭitátibus tuîs~; qŭi sanat omnes infirmitátes tuas. ^ Who forgiveth all thy iniquities~; who healeth all thy diseases.
4 ^ Qŭi rèdimit de intèritu vitam tuam~; qŭi corónat te in misericórdia et miseratiónibus. ^ Who redeemeth thy life from destruction~; who crowneth thee with mercy and compassion.
5 ^ Qŭi rèplet in bonîs desidèrium tuum~; renovábitur ut áquilaĕ juvèntûs tua. ^ Who satisfieth thy desire with good things~; thy youth shall be renewed like the eagle's.

column2: et judìcium òmnibus injúriam patièntibus. ^ The Lord maketh mercies
column3: and judgment for all that suffer wrong.

column1: 7 ^ Notas fecit vias suas Mosi~; fíliîs Israhélis voluntátes suas. ^ He hath made his ways known to Moses~; his wills to the children of Israel.
8 ^ Miserátor et misèricors Dòminus~; longánimis et multum misèricors. ^ The Lord is compassionate and merciful~; longsuffering and plenteous in mercy.

column2: nèqŭe in aĕtèrnum comminábitur. ^ He will not always be angry
column3: nor will he threaten for ever.

column1: 10 ^ Non secùndum peccáta nostra fecit nobîs
column2: nèqŭe secùndum iniqŭitátes nostras retrìbuit nobîs. ^ He hath not dealt with us according to our sins
column3: nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.

column1: 11 ^ Qŭóniam secùndum altitúdinem caĕli a terra
column2: corroborávit misericórdiam suam super timèntes se. ^ For according to the height of the heaven above the earth
column3: he hath strengthened his mercy towards them that fear him.

column2: longe fecit a nobîs iniqŭitátes nostras. ^ As far as the east is from the west
column3: so far hath he removed our iniquities from us.

column2: misèrtus est Dòminus timèntibus se. ^ As a father hath compassion on his children
column3: so hath the Lord compassion on them that fear him.

column2: recordátus est qŭóniam pulvis sumus. ^ For he knoweth our frame~; he remembereth that we are dust.

column3: tamqŭam flos agri sic efflorébit. ^ As for man
column4: his days are as grass~; as the flower of the field so shall he flourish.

column3: et non cognóscet ámplius locum suum. ^ For the spirit passed through him
column5: and he shall know his place no more.

column1: 17 ^ Misericórdia aŭtem Dòmini ab aĕtèrno et usqŭe in aĕtèrnum super timèntes eum
column2: et justìtia illíus in fílios filiórum
column3: ^ But the mercy of the Lord is from eternity and unto eternity upon them that fear him
column4: and his justice unto children's children

column2: et mèmores sunt mandatórum ipsíus ad facièndum ea. ^ to such as keep his covenant
column3: and are mindful of his commandments to do them.

column1: 19 ^ Dòminus in caĕlo parávit sedem suam
column2: et regnum ipsíus òmnibus dominábitur. ^ The Lord hath prepared his throne in heaven
column3: and his kingdom shall rule over all.

column4: ad aŭdièndam vocem sermónum ejus. ^ Bless the Lord
column5: all ye his angels~; you that are mighty in strength
column7: hearkening to the voice of his orders.

column4: qŭi fácitis voluntátem ejus. ^ Bless the Lord

column2: òmnia ópera ejus~; in omni loco dominatiónis ejus
column6: all his works~; in every place of his dominion
